I laughed when I read this title.
It is indeed quite a frustrating situation to be in as a support.
You remember that you yourself are not a juvenile child and treat others like human beings. You gain nothing by getting angry.

If this was a ADC complaining about shitty supports, he would get downvoted into oblivion for being a toxic rager who blames poor innocent supports.

People arent always gonna be on par with your skill, sometimes they're new to the role, sometimes they just suck.

When im ADC and i get blitz suppoet it's always a gamble he's either god of all hooks, or a minion grabber. But you dont flame him, you say meh and move on.

You just learn to deal with it and accept it as something that will happen on a daily basis.

If you know you're much smarter than they are, there's no point in trying to argue or even dump salt on them. Instead, acknowledge that you are smarter by playing smarter.

So in other words, try to figure out on how to work with bad ADCs. I know not every ADC player will be godly or even know what on earth is a Lulu support, and that's the kinds of backup plan you have to think of.

For example, if you *know* your ADC is too shitty to followup or for any given reason is incapable of following up, don't set up kills. If your ADC is always going HAM, learn to peel smarter and find ways to turn fights around; sometimes things work better when fights are started by your teammate getting caught out.
